intro: Adonis chaerophylla, commonly known as the alpine adonis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, yellow or orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are palmately compound, with finely divided lobes, and it has a short, stout stem. Adonis chaerophylla is often found in high-altitude environments, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
